data.title: Cherokee County
data.text:
JESSE GEORGE FAMILY PAGES

Footsteps of Jesse George

The following are the family group sheets contained in the book "Footsteps of Jesse George" 1996 by Doris Claiborne. The book also has photos of many of the families and are not included here. Thanks to Doris for permission to use this material on our web page. Use the "Find" feature of your word processor to search for the name that you want. Index follows page 133.

Page 1

Born: 1760 in: South Carolina

Mother: Unkn

1 William George

M Born: 1784 in: Virginia

Died: 6-Feb-1851 in:

2 John Carey George Sr.

M Born: 1793 in: South Carolina

Died: After 1870 in: Cherokee County, Texas

"EARLY INFORMATION ON THE GEORGE FAMILY OF CHEROKEE AND ANDERSON

COUNTIES" by Bettye Collier Smith

There is a strong possibility that Jesse George b:1760, of

Orangeburg District, S.C., later Barnwell County, S.C., was a

brother or cousin of Gotlieb George, b:1760, and Ludwig (Lewis)

George, b:c1756. Gotlieb George states in his revolutionary War

pension application that he was born in Switzerland; he was of

Swiss German stock.

Jake, Jesse, Gotlieb and Ludwig (Lewis) George were all of

Orangeburg District, S.C. When the county of Lexington was

formed in 1804, from Orangeburg District, Gotlieb was in the

newly formed county. Jesse and Ludwig (Lewis) were in the

newly formed county of Barnwell, formed in 1798, from Orangeburg

District, S.C.

From "German Settlements and the Lutheran Church in the

Carolinas" by Bernham, pgs 99-131, especially pg 102, we find -

"These German and Swiss settlers did not all arrive in Orangeburg

at the same time...........that emigrants(sic) from Germany

arrived in Orangeburg District as late as 1769, only a few years

before the revolution." Also mentioned are "Swiss reformed

(Calvinist) and Swiss Lutherans".
